thread.title: Princess Diana Diamond and Pearl Necklace Auction - Princess Diana Jewelry Auction
thread.title_full: Princess Diana Diamond and Pearl Necklace Auction - Princess Diana Jewelry Auction

author: Lauren Alexis Fisher
title: Princess Diana Diamond and Pearl Necklace Auction - Princess Diana Jewelry Auction
text:
Princess Diana redefined royal style, so it's no surprise that her iconic wardrobe and jewelry collection continue to make waves on the auction scene. The latest piece of the late princess to go on sale is a stunning diamond and pearl necklace, worn to one of her last public engagements before her death in 1997. Hand-crafted by the former Crown Jeweler, Garrard, the necklace consists of 178 diamonds and South Sea pearls. It's aptly named "The Swan Lake necklace," since Diana famously wore the piece to a performance of Swan Lake at London's Royal Albert Hall in June, 1997.
Princess Diana wearing the diamond and pearl necklace at a performance of Swan Lake in London. Getty Advertisement - Continue Reading Below At the time, the royal jeweler was also working on a pair of matching earrings to complete the set, but unfortunately Diana's tragic car accident occurred just two months later, before they were able to be finished and returned to her.
According to Us Weekly , auctioneers are reportedly expecting a whopping $12.1 million for the special piece. Currently, the necklace belongs to a Ukrainian couple who originally purchased it for $630,000, but are now expecting it to sky-rocket in value with a resale through the auction house Guernsey's .
